channel.title: [pi] starting positions [pi]
channel.description: can some1 tell me where to change the starting positon in pi and what to look for please and if you have time how to change the starter please :D

item.title: [pi] starting positions [pi]
item.dc:creator: @Tehlife Tehlife
item.description:
@Tehlife wrote:

[quote=“rash, post:3, topic:376311”][quote author=Tehlife link=topic=472250.msg3454205#msg3454205 date=1293941037]
Ok it’s really easy.
Go src -> server -> Config.java
Open it up.

Look for START_LOCATION
There you will see START_LOCATION_X and START_LOCATION_Y
After START_LOCATION_X is the x-pos
START_LOCATION_Y is the y-pos
Just change the x-pos and y-pos to what ever you want.
You will prob find out the numbers by going on the location and type ::mypos

Then save and compile

[/quote][/quote]
Lol didn’t notice.

Read full topic
